column8: A quality control testing study design type is where some aspect of the experiment is quality controlled for the purposes of quality assurance.
A cohort study for which the subjects are followed from the time of birth usually including information about gestation and follow up.
Study done at the population level or among the population groups
A study or biobank for which material and information is collected from subjects that have already developed a particular disease.

A case-control study design compares two groups of subjects: those with the disease or condition under study (cases) and a very similar group of subjects who do not have the disease or condition (controls).
A collection that is focusing on rare diseases
A collection that contains patients from a hospital
A type of observational study that involves data collection from a population
A form of longitudinal study for the analysis of risk factors following a group of people who do not have a disease
Twin studies measure the contribution of genetics (as opposed to environment) to a given trait or condition of interest.
Research studies involving repeated observations of the same entity over time. In the biobank context
